characters: A TABLE, (NOT A POOL TABLE, AN EATING-TABLE)
GUYS WHO DON'T THINK SHE'S HOT
INT. TV NEWS SHOW- THREE WEEKS LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The following is shot DOCUMENTARY-STYLE. A GIRLS VOLLEYBALL GAME has just ended. It was a big game championship. ONE TEAM is CELEBRATING -- jumping up and down, squealing hugging each other. We are focused on the bench of the TE LOST. They're very sad -- several are crying. One girl, in particular, (AMY) is really sobbing. She's s stained, tired and just blubbering. Stuff's coming out of her nose, her mouth and the camera is seeing it all. The COACH, a fortyish man looks at all the weeping girls particular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You quit! You gave up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He KICKS a CHAIR. Now Amy is really a mess. She's crying, coughing, shaking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right in Amy's face) You quit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coach storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Qutters! ... Quitters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy is wailing and choking on her own tears. This IMAGE FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that would be it. I don't think you need any narration at all. Just end it right there.

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN CREDITS
dialogues.text: We're in New York City. We're in the conference room of a successful cable TV station called "Real TV." The people young, energetic, clever. It's crowded, noisy -the furnit beaten up, bulletin boards cover the walls, with large in all over them. This room is not for show -- work gets done here. SEVEN OR EIGHT PEOPLE are present. One of them is CYNTHIA She's the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Cynthia) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's horrible, it's depressing, I love it. What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to re-pitch that pregnancy idea. Find six women early in their pregnancies and follow them all right through to the births.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (negative) Yeah, when all that stuff comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mixed reactions, mostly negative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is something I've been thinking about for a long time. We're "Real TV" right? I mean that's the name of the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's go real. We find someone. Just a regular person, someone. And we put their life on television - live... all day long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. No movement at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, like PBS did in the seventies? What was that family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Louds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We go way beyond that. We don't film it and edit it and put it on later. We go on the air live every morning and the show goes off each night, when our subject goes to bed. In between, we're on live all day, every day - the same person, -- for (shrugs) let's say a month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one is wild for this. Some hate it -- some are unconvi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a show that's a surveillance camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell we can't. Look, the beauty of being a cable  channel is we can take chances. I've thought about this and I'm telling you, I think this can make a noise. A loud one. There are twelve thousand channels. You've got to do something that says "Look at me!" Hell, people look at fish tanks all day. This is people! (more firmly) Someone's real life -- an TV, all day long - live... And, you know what? I'm doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. The others know the argument is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, we love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUS passes. On the bus is an ad. It says, "Would you like to star in your own TV show? Call Real TV (and a phone number) Coming (and a date)."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a nice upscale pool hall. A party is in progress special private area -- a room upstairs let's say -- a lo Thirty or forty PEOPLE in their twenties and thirties are informally celebrating the engagement of two of their fri It's NOISY, it's fun, it's informal. It's not a high-end By that we mean, not, for the most part young lawyers or stockbrokers. They're mostly blue-collar. Community colle graduates. WE OPEN ON ED PEKURNY. He's an attractive man, about thir There's still something a little juvenile about him -- no stupid, just boyish. SOMEONE is VIDEOTAPING HIM for one of those congratulatio montage things that are done at parties these days. Ed is at this. He's not professional but he's a loosey-goosey g who's kind of good on camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to congratulate Kevin and Tracy on their engagement. I knew you guys were meant for each other from the moment Tracy told us she was pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone else is cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocently) What? What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's going to see this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other people are being "interviewed" on tape. Ed is SHOOT with his buddy, JOHN. John's had a couple of drinks. He's melancholy. He is looking across the room, thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this -- people are getting married, they're getting married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're falling behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed waves dismissively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who we are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the guys who clean up after the parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna stick this right in your eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at this comedy club last week and this comedian says "If you're over thirty and your job requires you to wear a name tag, you screwed up your life." And I'm laughing and then I realize I wear a nametag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I. So what? I'm doing all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's here.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Ed's brother RAY and Ray's girlfriend SHARI arrive at the Shari is pretty in an unglamorous kind of way. They both then Shari goes off to talk to some of the LADIES and Ray and John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) I was... having dinner with Shari and her parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taunting) Oooh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's closing in on me. All of a sudden it's like a thing, it's a whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean all of a sudden? You've been going with her six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I mean I'm sitting there and her father's asking me about my "career prospects" and I'm playing "Risk," with her kid brother, Leon and at dinner the dog's sniffing at my balls -- at least I hope it was the dog. 'Cause her mother disappeared for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting wild. Some of the girls are dancing raucousl

dialogues.speaker: A TABLE, (NOT A POOL TABLE, AN EATING-TABLE)
dialogues.text: Ed, Ray, John, Shari and maybe another WOMAN. Ray is holding a big tray of SHRIMP BALLS. During the conversation, Ray throws them in the air and catches them his mouth like popcorn. Once, he even bounces one off the wall into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, those are for everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray waves dismissively, then gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! (to Shari) Show them that thing you can do. (to the others) This is great. I just found out she can do this, her brother told me. (to Shari) Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks it's stupid) I don't -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates, but she really doesn't mind. Slightly, amu takes her FIST and fits it completely INTO her MOUTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!! Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that unbelievable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that concludes today's show. (to Ray) This is where you go around and collect the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed LAUGHS. Ray gives her a KISS. Shari's roommate RITA sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know my roommate, Rita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do, vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's making audition tapes for that Real TV thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that thing. Yeah. Did you hear about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sure) Yeah, what - they put some schmuck on TV all day long or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that would be like a great thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That! Being that guy. Being the guy they watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but let's stay on one subject. Whoever that person is is going to be famous. They'll be able to get whatever they want. They'll ... trust me, this is my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in show business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I service video equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's like... those people stitching Nikes in Panama saying they're in the NBA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) I'm not stitching Nikes in Panama! ... Bedwetter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thumbsucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making a tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Shari, waiting for drink orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Ray met the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the dog really liked him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the whole family loved him. Of course, they loved the last guy I went out with, and he strung me along for three years and dumped me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You see, to me, you shouldn't have any trouble with men. There should be, like, a line behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Ed's beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Shari ARM-WRESTLING. After a struggle, Ed wins. Ed impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari wrings out her arm and picks up her beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing a previous conversation) And, you know, every guy I ever broke up with, the minute it was over, I could tell you what went wrong, how it went wrong, why it had to go wrong... but when I'm in it... lost. I'm like a love coroner. Bring me the corpse, I'11 tell you what killed it. But how to prevent it? Lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to camera) Hi. I'm Ray Pekurney. I'm from Paramus, New Jersey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's watching Ray's tape. Ray thinks he's funnier and cuter than he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my friends tell me "Ray, you've got too much personality for one guy." It's like at a party -- I'm at the center of the attention. Everybody loves me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets hit in the face by a hors d'oeuvre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha, ha, ha. I'll kick your ass. No really, let me show you my girlfriend. She's really cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out and grabs Shari's wrist. Shari is struggli to stay out of frame. We just see her arm and Ray pulling it. Ray lets go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's strong, 'cause she's a Fedex girl. She lifts those packages. But she's not dikey at all, she's really pretty.

dialogues.speaker: CYNTHIA FAST-FORWARDS
dialogues.text: WE SEE the camera shooting an empty space. Then Ed's head appears sideways right in front of the CAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello I'm Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to sniff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What smells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps back from the camera and straightens his head as he SNIFFS. He's more relaxed than Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that smell? Oop, I think it's this idea. One person on TV all day long? (screams) Are you nuts?

dialogues.speaker: WE HEAR LAUGHS
dialogues.text: The Real TV Staff are enjoying Ed's tape while they eat lunch out of styrofoam containers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, get your resumes in order. When my brother Ray - whose personality you were just dazzled by -- told me he was going to try out for this -- I said, "why in the world would anyone want to be on TV all day long, no privacy, everybody knowing your business, exposing every single detail of your life I mean... why would anyone want to do that? But then I thought of a reason... (loudly) Why the hell not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He KISSES the LENS, smudging it. Cynthia, watching, cracks up. The others seem to like him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a video store in Paramus, New Jersey. It's busy. PEOPLE are in line to check out tapes. WE OPEN ON a WOMAN -- a mother -- who is rummaging throug purse for her Blockbuster card. She looks up and sees tha TWO CHILDREN have opened several boxes of candy from the display and are eating from the boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh for -- Put those -- Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the boxes from them. The boxes are ripped more thought and candy goes flying all over. She bends to pick Ed appears. He works here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Mom) We'11 take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone arrives with a broom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the broom guy) Here. This time throw it out, don't eat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOU, the Manager passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou, can I talk to you a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lou seems like he'd prefer to avoid this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah, I was gonna ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal? Did anybody make a decision -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, look, uh... you're not getting the job. They're gonna transfer someone from another store to manage this store when I leave to manage the new store. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ. Did you go to bat for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I batted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You batted or you bunted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I went as far as I felt comfortable. I mean, you know, let's face it -- you come and go here as you please. You work when you feel like it -- you know, Bruce Springsteen's birthday is not a legal holiday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then I'm quitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, come on. What's that gonna do? You're gonna bring Blockbuster to their knees. Let me recommend a movie to you. It's called "Get your shit together before it's too late."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wise-ass) Who's in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed goes to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Yeah... Are you serious? ... Come on, no kidding, who is this? ... Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is being interviewed by the "Real TV" staff whom we me He's slightly less comfortable than on his tape, but he's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had one year of college. And then one year of junior college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you study?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, see, studying would've been a huge help. Where were you, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's Ray, my brother. He's... ambitious. Like a few years ago, he started this mobile dog-grooming business. But, like, out of his Camry. He had this bathtub in his trunk - (Ed starts cracking up) he's throwing the dogs in there, they're fighting and splashing, then he'd slam the trunk down, let 'em run around inside screaming getting all wet... then he'd use the car exhaust to dry'em. (wiping his eyes) Ah, Ray... he just can't get a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister -- Marcia, I mean she can't get a break. About seven years ago she falls in love with this Vietnamese guy who wants to marry her so he can stay in the country. So they get married, they have a kid, he gets his citizenship, immediately divorces my sister and marries this Vietnamese woman who, he was probably already married to all along. She can pick 'em. (pause) She's got a nice little boy, though. My nephew, Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mom's okay. Kinda. I knew a guy who hated his mother - Stuey Shwam. He hated his mother so much, he had his belly button removed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I've never been married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interviewer seems to be waiting for him to elaborate. He doesn't. He shrugs -- that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my father -what an asshole. When I was twelve, my mother needed a hysterectomy -- my father ran off with her nurse! And that's the last I heard of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al, my stepfather he's opinionated. And you have to listen because he's like in a wheelchair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like my job -- I mean I'm doing all right. I'm not sure how long I want to stay there, you know... I mean, I'm thirty-one... I'm not sure I want to be a video store clerk when I'm forty... Of course, I didn't expect to be doing it 'til I was thirty-one, either. But... you know I'm... keeping my options open. Anything comes along, I'm ready to pounce. (growls like a cougar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dream? Of course I have a dream I just don't know what the hell it is. (shrugs and smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's image freezes, while he has a funny-cute expression his face. PULL BACK TO REVEAL a TV in a conference room with Ed's frozen image on it. Cynthia is there with her bosses, the people who run the network that owns Real TV. The top man MR. SCHARLACH. His deputies are MS. SEAVER and MR. McILVA This is not the same place where we met Cynthia and her staff. This is richer, more corporate and formal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's who we want to go with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doubtfully) This guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I polled my staff. The men say they'd hang around with him and the women say he's fuckable. And one of the men said he's fuckable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure about the entire concept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look it's not like we're  burning up the airwaves now. We're running neck-and-neck with The Gardening Channel. If people just tune in to this twice a day for five minutes, we're a hit. Plus we can sell advertising every second, running at the bottom of the screen... and the beauty is this guy doesn't even have to be good. I mean if he's good, great. But if he winds up making an ass of himself, better. McILVAINE How is that better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. People cannot turn away from an accident. You drive by, you say "Ooh, I hope there's not a head lying in the road" but you look ! See, nobody in America wants to be nobody. This guy wants to be famous. So, basically, the deal is he agrees to drive down the highway a hundred miles an hour blindfolded and we get to see if his head winds up rolling down the highway. Fun for the whole family. So let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, waiting for approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's RE-STOCKING the SHELVES He gets goosed from behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very loud and happy) Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goosed) Oh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed DROPS the BOXES. Ray is there with Shari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your message. Way to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Shari. (to Ray) Let's go in the stockroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Ray enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when do you start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... I'm not gonna do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- there's a million ways to humiliate yourself - I gotta think of a new way? I mean, it's all day! Every minute. Id be like a monkey at the zoo. I just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Oh man! They couldn't pick me! They had to pick you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps a tape off a shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would do this? You would actually --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a second! In a hot second. Let me ask you something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever you ask me something why do you always say "Let me ask you something?" Why don't you just ask me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) All right. Let me ask you something... are you happy like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm doing all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Yeah? What's your master plan here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari enters, curious about the yelling. She stands there quietly, unnoticed by the guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be a video store clerk for the rest of your life? This is your big ambition, rearranging the "Ernest" movies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many opportunities are you going to get in your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You don't know. Doors don't fly open for guys like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You know-- we're not the same. I got a good life, this job suits me. I come and go when I please --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't bullshit a bullshitter. If you're happy like this you're an idiot, and you're not an idiot. (sees Shari) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed turns and sees Shari. She's self-conscious. She feels been caught eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I -- I heard Ray yelling. 1 didn't mean to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ed) Give me a chance. I'm begging you. I need a break. Look, I'11 cover your ass. I'11 ride shotgun. Just bring those cameras over to me and I'11 make something happen for both of us. I swear. Come on, Eddie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray lifts Ed up. Ray kisses Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shari) Is this guy a brother?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moderate-priced, restaurant. WE OPEN ON a CLOSE-UP of AL. He's about seventy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens when you go to the bathroom? Do they go in with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, Ray, Al, JEANETTE and MARCIA. Al is in a WHEELCHAIR a oxygen mask connected to a tank. He periodically takes a oxygen. He's a little short of breath, but loves to talk. is Ed's mother -- about sixty. Marcia is a little older t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The bathroom is off limits -and when I go to sleep they go to other programming. Unless I get up. Then they go back on the air. Unless I get up to go to the bathroom, I guess, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if--you're vomiting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I agree. What it reveals is the absolute creative bankruptcy in the television business. What they're saying, basically, is "We're giving up. We have no ideas."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's worse than that! They don't select someone with any talent, or with something to say -- they seem to celebrate the fact that this guy is a boob. It's a joyous celebration of boobery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we've already spent far too much time discussing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN ON Ray with chopsticks up his nose, imitating a walr Also, he has lo mein noodles protruding from between his Ed is forcing a smile. Ray is wearing a tee-shirt that sa "Ray and Bucky- Video Kings" with a phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia is alone working late. She's drinking. She's watc Ray. She's not enjoying him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, don't throw the shrimp, you're gonna choke again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choke to death, you boring bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is sitting up in bed, wearing shorts and a tee-shirt, directly out of a cereal box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience likes you when you're moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Try not to stay in one place too long. Get outside as much as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, we have some notions. Have you thought about becoming a Big Brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or coaching a Little League team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just, the ratings are still soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Are you going to cancel me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not worry about that vet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're testing well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's another problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's ... Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the walrus impression - delightful as it was -- is just not wowing the audience. This is some audience research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Ed a PRINTOUT. Ed doesn't know how to interpret figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means they hate his freaking guts. It means if he were on fire they wouldn't put him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just ... trying a little too hard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, the audience can smell the desperation coming through the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you... see him a little less often?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much less?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never would be plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that to him. He's pushing a little too hard - but... I just can't do that to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'11 be fine.

dialogues.speaker: "DAY FIVE"
dialogues.text: Ed is driving slowly on a busy street. Suddenly an  EIGHTEEN YEAR-OLD BOY lands heavily on Ed's windshield. E startled. He can't see. He swerves and stops. The boy is hurt. He's banging on the windshield, waving at the camer Ed, furious, gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on TV! I'm on TV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed just stares in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is walking. PEOPLE YELL at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed! Your show stinks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guy LAUGHS like he really got in a good one. Ed ignor TWO TEENAGERS run in, one has a camera and quickly snaps picture of Ed and the other Guy. Merrily, they shake his and run off, whooping. There are PEOPLE who trail along. Many of them will show again and again, throughout the movie, following Ed. Some them will look mentally or emotionally impaired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK SHOTS of Ed with CUSTOMERS - One or two show a bit camera-consciousness. A little group has gathered to obse Ed's "show".

dialogues.speaker: INT. APARTMENT BUILDING HALLWAY- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ed rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) This is Ray's apartment. Ray's got a big-screen TV and the Knicks are playing in L.A. tonight, so sometimes I come over after I work late and we watch the game here. He makes funny comments. He's really a good guy. He just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens a crack, revealing Ray in a bathrobe. Ray' look is unwelcoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watching the ballgame?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no, uh I'm a little tired. I fell asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. All right. I'11 watch at home, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, where do you keep the glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is Shari here? Why didn't you just say so? Why are you giving me a song-and-dance about being tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) Hi, Shari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Shari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray looks pained. Ed realizes what's happening and freeze Ray's phone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to answer his phone, allowing the door to swing a little. Ed can see into the kitchen. He sees a WOMAN, wearing just panties, facing away from him, searching for glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello... Shari, hi... Oh no! ... Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) We'd better go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAPID CUTS of VIEWERS loving this, some screaming "Don't don't leave, stay" etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) No, honey, it's not what it looks like--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up on him. He holds his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God ... Ed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is TIP-TOEING away. He stops when Ray calls him. Ray ' out into the hallway after him. They speak with lowered voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Shari. She saw the whole thing on TV--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? What's going on, who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) It's the receptionist at one of the places I service video equipment -- she's very pretty and, you know, she never even talks to me and then today I come in and she's all "I saw you on TV the other night... You were so great ... " Next thing I know we're ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next thing you know! Why didn't you stop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop? I'm a guy. I don't stop. The woman's supposed to stop. We're the gas, they're the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls out) Ray, I finished the Snapple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cabinet, but it's warm. There's ice in the tray. I  (to Ed) Talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know her. All I know is she likes Snapple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not her. Shari. Go over there and talk to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She THROWS SOMETHING at the screen. She PICKS UP the PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought the cameras here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought the girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go over to Shari, the camera's going there, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camera Operators are vigorously nodding and mouthing Ray is oblivious to this, but Ed picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. She'11 -- you know control herself. Look. If I go over there, she's just gonna slam the door on me. Just go over and beg her to talk to me, that's all. Please. You owe me for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed accepts the irony of Ray's attitude without comment

dialogues.speaker: INT. ANOTHER HALLWAY- NIGHT
dialogues.text: The door opens, revealing RITA, Shari's roommate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) Um... Shari knew you were coming over because she saw ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, yeah --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic) She really doesn't want you and the camera in here right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I understand. That's - where is she, is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita isn't sure how much she should reveal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... gave her a drink. I thought it ... but she's not much of a drinker, so it's made her a little... belligerent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari appears in the doorway over Rita's shoulder. she's holding a liquor bottle and she's a little drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward) Shari, I'm just really sorry. Look, I know this is... unbelievably awkward, but if I could come in for like a second and -- you know -- just say... two words, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari indicates with her head, that Ed can come in. Ed and Carlos enter. Rita shuts the door. Shari crosses t couch. Ed indicates for Carlos to give them some distance

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose them, Carlos. This is gold. Stay out of their way, but get everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlos settles across the room. He rests the camera down he's not even shooting, but he's still guiding it where h wants it throughout the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go to bed. (to Shari) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives the camera a quick glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly, with a small wave) Hi, Mom. (she exits)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari, Ray feels --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) Don't defend that horse's ass to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not. I'm not. I'm just Look -- you know, in a way, it's good. He got this out of his system now and he knows it's not worth it and, you know, someday if you guys got married or something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (poking Ed as she talks) I've got news for you-- I never intended to marry him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... how come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, watching on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for one thing, he's a bad lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes bulge out and he begins to gasp. RAPID SHOTS of viewers reacting-- "Whoa!" laughs, etc. Th college girls applauding. one of them SCREAMS "Tell it!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed realizes that Ray's been called a "bad lay" on televis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (directly into the camera) I mean bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, not having been there... I just think you're hurt and you're saying this to, you know, get back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... whether you get back together or not, you're too terrific a person to... lower yourself like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray, still in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I told Ray -- a couple of times -- that I thought you were one of the best and ... smartest and... most attractive women I've ever seen so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In comforting her, he's gotten his face very close to her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same dorm girls as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss him! Kiss him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tilts her head forward a little, hesitates, then kiss him, at first warmly, then passionately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are going wild-- SCREECHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nuts, hah?! I knew it! I said!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dials the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares, amazed. The WOMAN he was found with appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found the Snapple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! I win! Scharlach, you schmuck! I am the golden goddess of television!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins beating her chest, one fist at a time while sh SCREAMS in triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari and Ed have stopped kissing. They both look stunned Shari is suddenly sober.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Carlos who has now moved closer to them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... okay

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kissed my boyfriend's brother on television!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when you put it that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave. Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting) All right. Okay. I'11 ... see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Carlos exit. Going through the door, he gives Carl little push then quickly steps back inside, slams the doo locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm locked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm. Shoot the door. We're running sound. And we've got a camera in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAMERA is shooting at a second-story window. We SEE SILHOUETTES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is at the door. Shari is across the room. They stare a each other silently. Then they run to each other. They ki again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can SEE them KISSING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Shari are all over each other. They're breathless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to tell you something. I have had a big thing for you for months.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF VIEWERS
dialogues.text: They're seeing the door or the silhouette shot, but they' hearing every word. They're mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I mean for months I've been seeing you with Ray you being his girlfriend and I kept wishing you were my girlfriend... But, you know, what could I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. I mean I'm going out with Ray and I'm... thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, this is so weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird? If this happened last month it would've been weird. Now with... the TV and... now it's just too weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. They don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. He walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. They run back to each other and kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouettes are kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray staring at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: "DAY SIX"
dialogues.text: This is a fairly old, modest private home. Ed pulls up. H and Carlos get out of the car. Ed hurries up to the front and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed enters. He's a little AGITATED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al is in his wheelchair and taking periodic hits off an o mask connected to a tank. Al's watching himself on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Look. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He WAVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I brought you some movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I intentionally picked out a lot of crap 'cause I don't like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mom here? I gotta talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the kitchen. I'd yell for her, but I'd die. (sucks more oxygen) You had a busy night last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls) Yeah. Ma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie? ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are the TV people with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. The camera guy is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send him? Ma, I can't. it's -- just come out here. Please, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want us to come in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's a mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Ma, come on out. Really. I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a pause, Jeanette enters, very camera-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) This is my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STIFFLY, he gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma, do you know where Ray is? I've been calling him and I'm getting his machine and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, how could you do it? Your brother's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, he cheated on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to -- do you know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Maybe he's watching. (indicates the camera) Tell him you're sorry. Tell him you'11 stay away from that girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! And that girl has a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you love her or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Look at your face. I had a car that color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS REACTIONS OF VIEWERS really liking this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you. This Shari is a passing fancy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I -- All right, look, if you hear from Ray.... tell him to call me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He KISSES her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Marcia? She all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. She's living with that "entertainer"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to make his mother feel better) Well, who knows? Maybe she finally picked a winner this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconvinced) Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Al lived together a few months before you got married -- after Dad left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the TV) Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, that worked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets in the closet and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) I think we're through here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Real TV group is there. They're smiling. Cynthia is ON the PHONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I will. I'11 tell them. (hangs up) That was Scharlach. All of you, scrub your asses. He's coming over to kiss them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all WHOOP and LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari and Rita are watching Ed leave his parents house on Rita is very excited. Shari is ON the PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Um, I'd like to get a new phone number, please... Because I'm getting calls from every nut case in America... Right, unlisted... Sure. (she holds)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you excited? He said he loved you on television!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say it. His stepfather said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joking) Well, the stepfather's cute... Seriously, how do you feel about Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he's great. He just makes me feel... oh, I'm really gonna get hurt, this time - Hello ...

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS VIEWERS WATCHING REAL TV
dialogues.text: End on TAD and BARRY in a health club. This is the refres area. They've played racquetball and they're sweaty. They watching Real TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 tell you something else. The old guy in the wheelchair? The stepfather? They're gonna have him die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean "they're gonna have him die?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, for a tearjerker. The audience falls in love with this loveable old geezer in a wheelchair and then he dies, it's ... They know what they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is real, Bananahead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if it's a show and they have a guy die that's writing, but if it's real and they have a guy die that's murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed arrives for work. People CALL OUT to him-- PEDESTRIANS, PEOPLE FROM CARS, T DRIVERS. "Hey Ed, my man." Ed waves. People shake his han A teenage boy looks into the camera, making a funny face. Someone else looks into the camera and says, "Hi, Ma." Suddenly, Ray is there with a WOMAN. Ray is not happy. He wearing DARK GLASSES and a HAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Ray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, I've been trying to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we gotta talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUY in a car appears and points at Ray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're that French guy on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur Bad-a-lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy drives away. Ray is steaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just do what I came here to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed thinks he means to fight. Ed tries to calm him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna fight? Ray, please, listen to me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beckoning) Cassie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CASSIE, a woman about Ray's age, steps forward. She's sli self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray points Cassie to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is really hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Soaring is good, right? I mean, that means you're not gonna cancel me, right?

dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.text: Ed, why didn't you go over to see Shari today? That's what all our viewers were hoping you'd do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't she great? I mean, maybe just to me, but... I don't know, she's just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently) She's great, she's great. Why didn't you go see her?

dialogues.text: I wanted to! I was dying to! But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Ray? (pulls out research) The audience hates Ray. Females, 18 to 35 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't need to hear that. Cynthia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Ed.

dialogues.text: Could we just talk alone for a second? I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. (to her staff) Could you all leave us alone for a few minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She PANTOMIMES for them to stay in the room, but be quiet staff scrape chair legs and feign movement and ad lib "By "See you, buddy" etc. They all stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing, Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like when I was a kid and my mother sent me to school in orange corduroy pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no clue) Uh-huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all the kids stared calling me "Pumpkin Ass." "Hey Pumpkin Ass," -- for like a year. So, now, I feel like everyone's watching me and, you know, I'm "Pumpkin Ass" again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff are stifling giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I tell you something? I think you are fantastic. I think you have taken an idea and turned it into something explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The staff stifle laughter. One of the guys is doing a jer gesture. Cynthia gives them the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.text: Can I give you one bit of advice? About Shari?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so exciting! A real celebrity delivering my figs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Ray was a pig. Ed is doll. You latch on to him honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Some more make-up wouldn't do you any harm. On TV you look a little washed out.

dialogues.text: What would I actually have to do to get you to sign this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted) Oh, an TV a minute and already an attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed) By the X. That's were two lines cross -- forming an X.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGRILY, the Woman signs and slams the door. She heads back to her truck. She looks up and Ed is there flowers. The TV cameras are there also. Shari is startled But she's also glad to see him.

dialogues.text: You know, I never saw you in your uniform before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...

dialogues.text: They both LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really a tremendous turnoff.

dialogues.text: You should see the one we wear when it rains.

dialogues.text: Sunday night at the Devils game, I'm driving the Zamboni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Look, I know this is weird. But... I don't want to wait. I really think we might have something together. Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EMBARRASSED, she nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Be my zamboni date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't say "no." They KISS -- a little hesitantly, not passionately, but affectionately. She's still self-conscious, but she's goi with the flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

This makes Shari laugh relaxes her.

More people press towards Ed. It's too crowded -- dangero Shari is swept away from Ed. She's buffeted about, violen She goes down. Ed can't move. The Crowd is friendly and happy, but the effect is scary.

dialogues.text: BOUNCERS squeeze Ed and Shari out the door, protecting th Ed is unnerved. Shari is somewhat bedraggled. Her clothin torn.

dialogues.text: Yeah?!

dialogues.text: We're going to get you a bodyguard, don't worry. Ed, I have some news for you. We're picking up Ed TV for another month!

He spreads it out wide to block Shari's face from the cameras. He leans in and they KISS the lips, several times, while Ed's jacket screens off th cameras. They're in love.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TV NEWS SHOW- THREE WEEKS LATER
dialogues.text: Written on the screen -- "Day 26." It's the same news team we met earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, welve had pet rocks, hula hoops, Davy Crockett, Beatle wigs, and leisure suits. But America's latest craze is a guy named Ed. Here with that story is entertainment reporter, Rick Douglas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pat, four weeks ago, no one in America had even heard of Ed Pekurny. Today, this thirty-one year-old video store clerk has become something of a national obsession. The words viewers use to describe him are "charming," "natural," and "appealing." And ratings indicate that "Ed TV" is being watched by more people, each day, than any show in the history of cable television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT of Scharlach being interviewed. A CAPTION identifi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This idea just came to me. I told my staff -- if people just tune in twice a day for five minutes we're a hit. Sometimes you gotta go with your gut feeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's watching. She's ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it came to you! Because I brought it to you! (raises her fist) You want a gut feeling?! How about a groin feeling?! (raises her foot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed TV has become so popular that when Ed goes to sleep Real TV is running highlights of Ed's day all night. Some viewers have become obsessed with Ed. They wake up when Ed wakes up, they go to sleep when Ed goes to sleep, and in between they try to watch as much of him as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) Yeah, I watch it... More than I'd like to admit sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about fifty) Never... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just kind of leave it an, you know, so it's... there.

dialogues.text: I like her. She's sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not hot. Not.

dialogues.text: What's wrong with her! Everytime you look at this chick, it's like she badly needs a Tampax. Ed, you can do better.

dialogues.text: Ed and Shari are on a date. A WAITRESS is taking their or Shari still seems a little self-conscious, but Ed is havi ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saturday, I think we should

dialogues.text: (plugging) Compliments of Motorola. Hello... Marcia?? (to Shari) My sister. -- What? ... What, right now? ... I'm eating, I'm on a date! ... Well, where's your boyfriend -- what's his name? Cliff .... Then, call a cab... (wearily) All right. Look, just don't start any trouble okay. Just sit there quietly 'til I get there... you're welcome.

dialogues.text: He HANGS UP. He's disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This used to be a regular thing. And the worst part, is while she'd be waiting for me to come down to some bar and get her, she'd start up with some guy and say "Wait 'til my brother gets here, he'11 kick your ass." So then I walk in and there's some rhinoceros in a windbreaker who tries to shove me into a shot glass. And Marcia's drunk and screaming "Kick his ass, Ed. Kick his ass." (looks out) I think this is it.

dialogues.text: See, like you.

dialogues.text: Yeah. Keep up the good work.

dialogues.text: Oh great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Oh -- okay, now I get it. It's "Star Search." You wanted me here because the camera comes with me.

dialogues.text: I can imagine. You said you wanted nothing to do with this. You swore to me. "Don't come near me. Don't bring this into my life..."

dialogues.text: For God sakes, you said two words about some lousy pizza joint, the guy's a millionaire now. This could be my whole future we're talking about. (to Shari) Hi, I'm Ed's sister.

dialogues.text: Cliff is in the middle of his show. He's wearing a PORTABLE ORGAN. He's not great. He's a sma professional with a lot of pep. Marcia is beaming. Ed's cameras are shooting him. CUTS OF Cliff, singing every type of song, imaginable. Th guy is desperately trying to cover all the bases -- i.e. Sinatra-type standards, something from "Lion King", "Do Y Think I'm Sexy," "Smokin' in the Boy's Room," "Hey, Hey, the Monkees," the theme from "Hawaii Five-0," a rap numbe "Ave Maria."

dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: I told you. If we... you know do it, they go away until ... we're done.

dialogues.text: I know, but even if they go away, everybody in America knows what we're doing because... they went away.

dialogues.text: So? What do they think -- we're not kids --

dialogues.text: (overlapping) I know, I ...

dialogues.text: Really? (he looks)

dialogues.text: I'm out here an hour a night and I feel like a dork. You're on every minute! Doesn't it just drive you nuts?

dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Yeah.

dialogues.text: All this fame and the money you're making. Is this going to change you, do you think?

dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.text: RAPID CUTS of VIEWERS, excited. Many of them reach for th phone.

dialogues.text: Written on the screen -- "Day 35" Ed and his mother are arguing. Al is sucking oxygen and h pile of "People" magazines with Ed on the cover. A REPAIR is fixing the refrigerator. All their food is out and mel Jeanette is trying to preserve food in an ice chest while argues with Ed.

dialogues.text: I can't believe you're taking his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably) If I don't call you "Dad" it' just because... 1 was already a big boy when you came into our lives -- (pointedly to his mother) or when I thought you came into our lives --
