dialogues.text: Written on the screen -- "Day 48" Ed is walking, the camera following. He looks tense. Peop SHOUT "Hey, Ed" "Ed-die" etc.

dialogues.speaker: A NEWSPAPER VENDING MACHINE
dialogues.text: The New York Post front page -- "Is tonight the Night?" w picture of Ed and Jill kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving the "thumbs up") Go for it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed continues down the street. People YELL to him "Good lu tonight," "We're rooting for you" etc. A STREET CHARACTER walks alongside for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man. This is Haitian Love Juice. (he produces a vial) You give her this, she be yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security grabs him and the vial falls and breaks. The liq hits the pavement and smokes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the smoke) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More shouts "Be gentle", "We'11 be watching", "Use a cond A SCHOOL BUS passes. The KIDS YELL out the window to Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison) Good luck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no line. At TICKET TAKER sits, bored. No one is going in or coming out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty. The HEADWAITER stands in the doorway with not to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PARTY is in progress. The TV is on. On TV Ed is in a li store, buying a bottle of wine. Ed is dressed for his dat The people at the party are watching TV and commenting. I like a Super bowl party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's buying wine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several high-school age BOYS. They have made themselves l like Ed. They're very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's gonna do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. The guy hasn't had any sex in six weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither have we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's car turns the corner and he sees a CROWD gathered ar building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understating) I'm starting to feel a little pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed carrying his wine enters to APPLAUSE and CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG SHOT encompasses all the houses on the block. Thei living room TV's are visible. All but one are tuned to Ed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something is cooking. Jill picks up a plate of something dip and cut vegetables for instance. She starts to exit t kitchen as Ed and Carlos enter. Ed and Jill have a soft collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help with anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's going to be about a half-hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is? Oh, dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELF-CONSCIOUSLY. He takes a vegetable, dips it and eats

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other. Jill leans forward and kisses hi She puts the tray of vegetables on the counter. They cont to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The high school boys are CHANTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed -- Ed -- Ed -- Ed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLLEGE GIRLS (same ones as before).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I hope she makes love to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, but I want him to be happy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAPID SHOTS of other VIEWERS, watching, transfixed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Jill are making out. They begin taking each other' clothes off. They're passing the point of no return. It's going to happen right there in the kitchen. Ed and Jill, in heavy heat, back up to the kitchen table climb on to it. They continue to pull at their own and ea other's clothing. They're making passionate noises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari is not watching television. She's eating a little m she's made for herself. She HEARS PEOPLE in her building cheering and whooping. She looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly panicky) Someone say the word, how far can we go here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia and her staff are watching. Cynthia is ON THE PHO CYNTHIA (into phone) Stay with them ... don't leave yet... not yet ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill is on top of Ed. Carried away with passion, Ed attem to roll her over and get on top. He does, but rolls too f He crashes off the table, to the floor, face up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) Ohhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh... do you own a cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is being loaded into an AMBULANCE. He looks humiliated PEOPLE in the street are applauding politely as if Ed wer injured ballplayer being carried off the field. Jill is b ambulance. She's PETTING a CAT who looks all right. PHOTOGRAPHERS are taking her picture. She's posing willin The ambulance drives off as Jill continues to pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Written on the screen -- "Day 49" The taping of "The Tonight Show" or "the Late Show" -- on again, whichever we have a prayer of getting. The MONOLOG in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock annoyed) So I guess you were all watching Ed last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AUDIENCE goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This got the highest rating of the year, since the Super Bowl. I guess that makes sense. After all, Ed is now the Buffalo Bills of sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scharlach EATING. He's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him off the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? He's fine. He's out of the hospital already. The ratings are higher than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, it's peaked. Ed TV is an over-inflated balloon. Get it off before it explodes all over us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Cynthia you're nuts. I'm giving him another month!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coldly) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: "DAY 54"
dialogues.text: Ed is walking. He's wearing a white, Velcro support aroun waist. He's agitated. He's carrying a copy of the New Yor Post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE a headline -- "Ed: She Broke My heart."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did not! (venting) You know what she did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went out to California and got one of those scandal agents. One of those agents who handle, like... Gennifer Flowers and... Kato Kaelin and Joey Buttafuco. That's what she --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Ed! ... She was a little too much for you, huh? Must run in the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) Oh -- like this guy's ever been with a woman. (yells) How about I kick your ass 'til the crack goes the other way? (to the camera) All of a sudden, I'm like fair game for everyone. I'm like --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops and looks like he's in shock. He stares in throu the display window of a bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a big DISPLAY of cheap, rushed-out, exploitation books. O cover we read "My Brother Pissed On Me By Raymond L. Peku And there's an old photo of two little boys. (Ed and Ray)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my -- He wrote a book?! Ray wrote a book?! He never read a book!

dialogues.speaker: "DAY 58"
dialogues.text: It's the hallway of a cheap hotel. Ed and the camera come the elevator. Ed looks at room numbers. He can HEAR the n from all the rooms. A radio -- a domestic disturbance -- baby crying -- it's a horror. He KNOCKS ON a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens REVEALING Ed's father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed! Come in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's depressing. There's a liquor bottle on the dresser. sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How've you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed SHRUGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't get cable here, so 1 can't watch you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed just GRUNTS. Hank takes LAUNDRY off a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a shithole, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be, if you fixed it up. How did you... ? I mean how does anyone ... wind up like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole time? Eighteen years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Two times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check forging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man! So...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last two years, I've been a limousine driver, but I don't see well anymore, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you saw me on TV and you said "Hey, let me jump on this."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need help. How many times if just one little thing that I needed would've happened, it would've changed everything. If I had a few dollars when an opportunity came along or... the tumblers just never clicked for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed doesn't know what to say. He's bitter towards Hank, bu there's also some empathy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) All right... This is my father, I don't know what the hell he can do, but if anyone out there can help him -- get him a job - I'11 ... help you. I'11 ... mention your business or ... I don't know, we'11 figure it out. (quickly, to Hank) I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed... I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still bitter) Yeah? That's good. Sorry is good. You know I finished that model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pirate ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank looks blankly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That we were doing "together." I finished it. It came out great! Because no one was standing over my shoulder bothering me - "That's too much glue. You're using too much glue."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Ray sat on it. I'11 see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits. Out in the hallway, he leans back against the d drained. The camera is right on him, soaking it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same PBS-type panel of smart-looking people we met ea WE OPEN ON about half the panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear from our guest panelist. You've expressed some interesting thoughts on this, subject. What do you see as the meaning, if there is any, of Ed TV, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL JOHN, sitting comfortably on the panel, looking ve wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel that Ed is the apotheosis of a prevailing American syndrome. It used to be that someone became famous because they were special. Now people are considered special just for being famous. Fame, itself, is now a moral good in this country. It's its own virtue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others NOD appreciatively as John puts a PIPE in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was Ed's Little League coach. He had no coordination. The big game, he struck cut with the bases loaded. Then he cried like a woman. It was sickening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was his third grade teacher. I said "Take him for tests. There's something wrong with him." They didn't listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to steal things from my store. At least I think it was him. Yeah, it was probably him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN, on the sidewalk, has a STUFFED CAT stuck to his ba tease Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I just fell off a table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a TUBFUL OF WATER crashes down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed at the window, with a now empty plastic tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling down) Okay, is that funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he throws the tub out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) How was that? Was that funny?!

dialogues.speaker: "DAY 78"
dialogues.text: Again, everyone there, including Cynthia. A Honcho is rea a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of more concern than the sag in Ed's ratings is what viewers are feeling about him now. The positives are down and the negatives are up. There's a feeling that Ed isn't cool anymore. We're starting to see a big L.F.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.F.  Loser Factor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's deadly. McILVAINE Not necessarily. I mean instead of running from the L.F., run with it. Create more moments like the table thing. We can package a video "Ed's Goofiest Moments." Let him be America's Goofball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't this getting kind of pathetic. I mean we drank the juice, now we're just licking peel. Let it go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia, I think you're laboring under a misconception. You seem to believe that because you happened to predict this, we should be impressed. We're not. Anybody in any business can predict failure. 1 need people who prevent failure. I want to see this thing turned back in the right direction. Remember this was your baby.

dialogues.speaker: "DAY 94"
dialogues.text: Tad and Barry -- as we met them, originally -- are watchi They're really enjoying it -- laughing, pounding the tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I still love this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah only I wish they had the sister on more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, the sister! She is hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL that they are watching Joma. On the TV -- Joma is eating dinner in his apartment with TWO attractive WOMEN, apparently, both live there. Joma is upset (but he's funn when he's upset). What's upsetting him is that across the alley, in a window of another building, he can plainly se OVERWEIGHT MAN, with his shirt off, exercising. The overw man is apparently watching an exercise video and is bounc and down in place causing everything to jiggle unpleasant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! It's like a mudslide. (screams out the window) Put on a shirt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) I support the fact that your exercising but, for the love of God, put on a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Joma) Shut the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Let him shut the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: TAD AND BARRY
dialogues.text: Laughing and wiping their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the air. Ed ON the PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This Joma is so phoney! I mean, those things aren't really happening. I think they have writers making that stuff up for him. Hey, couldn't we do that? Hire some writers and have them write up some crazy situations I could get into?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's listening, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed, everything goes off. "Cheers" went off. "Mash" went off --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting angry) Yeah, but when they went off people weren't making fun of them. They weren't bozos! I'm Pumpkin Ass again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting annoyed) Ed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, everything you asked me to do I did. I call you for advice about Shari you say - (mocking imitation) "Leave her be, see other people for a while." You just wanted me to get involved with Jill because it made for a better show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You screwed up my life just so you could get higher ratings. You never gave a shit about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Well I'm not starting now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HANGS UP and has an acid reflux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and John are playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you put anybody on TV sixteen hours a day, at some point they're going to wind up rolling off a table on to a cat. I mean with no privacy, there's no... dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed thinks. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about that fireman who rescued that little girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When? Today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Like, ten years ago. In Texas. Baby... (tries to remember) Jessica!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right, right! She fell down, like a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, a thing. He became a big hero. He was on TV and there was a parade and a movie about him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, uh... you know it blew over and he went back to being a fireman again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he killed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little shaken) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. The cell phone RINGS. Ed PICKS UP the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: JEANETTE IN A HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: She's crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead! Eddie, he's dead! It was his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. What hospital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St. Joseph's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming right over. I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tad is watching TV and talking an the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you! I told you he was gonna die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed rushes in. He goes up to the desk. Carlos is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm looking for my mother. Her name is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR spots him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pekurny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dr. Geller. Your mother is just lying down for a few minutes. we gave her something to calm her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Can I see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait here. She's coming right back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm... (wearily) Oh, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him -- did he suffer any or was it quick? I'd hate to think he...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very quick. Between you and me, it's not a bad way to go. Making love to your wife... it's very sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? They were..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) According to your mother. When the paramedics got to the hotel, she told them that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotel? What were they doing in a hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ... don't know. I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie. Thank God you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks across the room and sees Al in his wheelchair entering from outside. He wheels towards Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Al!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our neighbors gave me a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she? Is she all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed turns to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought -- I thought he was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (reads his chart) The deceased is ... Henry Pekurny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Good twist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought it was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your father. Hank. Your mother went to see him and he had a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Went --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, Ed turns to the doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Geller, Dr. Stack wants to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ed) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ed) Could I get your autograph for my niece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted) Um... yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanette enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al! How did you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burkharts drove me. Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously) I'm fine. I ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I gotta pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wheels off. Jeanette and Ed are left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was horrible. He called me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank! He said he wanted to talk to me to apologize for everything he begged -- he cried. So I went to this horrible hotel he was staying in... I felt so sorry for him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you had sex with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeanette GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor said you were having sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) To you? In front of him? (indicates Carlos) With the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He assumed Hank was your husband. He didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! On TV!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? How...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing led to another. He was my husband once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Al is your husband now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's been easy for me? It's been years. Al can't have sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently, neither can Hank. What the hell did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al comes rolling back, SINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Lovely Rita, the Meter Maid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Don't tell Al. He doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the camera) Well, he's the only one in America who doesn't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPRAH or RICKI or GERALDO or someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women who remarry but have sex with their first husbands. on today's Oprah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our same panel of pundits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed's family is the tip of the iceberg. You watch the daytime tabloid shows it's the same thing. I'm telling you, America is fast becoming a trailer park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not overstate the case. There are millions of hard- working, sensible, moral, educated people in this country. Not every family is like Ed's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL ED watching this discussion on TV.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE OR JAY
dialogues.text: A CHART is set up with little pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's recap. The mother's too good at it, both brothers stink at it. (there's a drawing of a figure falling of a table) The stepfather can't do it at all and the father did it but it killed him. (there's a drawing of a tombstone) How did this family ever reproduce in the first place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is driving Jeanette and Al to the funeral. A CROWD is POLICE. Someone yells "Adulterer". Someone else tries to lunchbox. Someone else is carrying a sign "What a Way to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank's COFFIN is being carried to his gravesite. Ed, Ray are pall bearers. One of the others pall bearers is Ed's The OTHERS TWO are two guys who work for the mortuary. Ca shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray) You're not going to talk to me? You're not even gonna say hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing to say to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed gives up. He turns to Marcia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you doing? Is Cliff here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer. Ed reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff left her, thanks to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. You put Cliff on television. So then he decided he was too good for her and he left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put his -- who -- (to Marcia) Look, Marsh, he's not that good a singer, he'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (too loudly) That's not funny!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed CRINGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The service ends. The small group begins to walk away. Ra and Marcia go off together, ignoring Ed. Jeanette is attempting to wheel Al away from the grave, but she's hit ruts. Ed approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Al, uncomfortably) Sweetheart, I'm gonna go ahead and sign all the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She touches him but he pulls away. Ed wheels Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are things gonna be okay with you and Mom? Is there anything I can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be living with my brother. He's not in such good shape as I am, but... I'm looking forward to the pillow fights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really upset) Oh, Al ... This is just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hank was always good with the ladies. Always good-looking. Hell, he's been dead for two days, he still looks better than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops wheeling and crouches down next to Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to tell you something... I love you. You're my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al KISSES him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 build a pirate ship with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed wheels him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's watching. She's genuinely moved. She wipes her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is sleazy. Ed enters, worn out. He crosses to bar where we find, Jeanette nursing a drink. She's not dr but she is wallowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Ed! How did you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're famous. Somebody called me. What are you doing in a place like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why shouldn't I be in a place like this? I'm a whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringes) Ma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a tramp (pulls on the sleeve of the man next to her) Meet your new father. The whole nation is laughing at us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how is this helping? come on say, good-night to all your new friends and let's go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting) I'm a whore! (yells at an employee) Your bathrooms are filthy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is helping Jeanette. Ray arrives. He's ANGRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 take her. You humiliated our mother on national television. You've single- handedly destroyed this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- Oh, but that book you wrote was a real love-letter. That... toilet paper with covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That book sucked. I want my money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great. Where's Moe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around. Moe is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ray) Let's remember how I got into this. "Please, Eddie, do this for me. I can't get a break." (pretends to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what your problem is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. My problem is I've got a brother who writes a sentence like "We grew up in a small, little bedroom." As opposed to a big, little bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got paid by the word! No! Your problem is you don't ever want anything to be your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?! That's you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I commit. I take a chance. You wanted to be the guy on TV, but you didn't want to say you wanted to. So you have me talk you into it so you get what you want, but if it goes bad it's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Like you say you love Shari, but, you wouldn't mind noodling that model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? So does a kick in the nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For once in your life, be honest with yourself. I know you, Ed. I know you look at me and Marcia and Mom and you think you're different. You're like "How did I end up in this family?" You're not different. you're worse. Because you have no guts.  You drift around, you don't commit, you make fun of me -- okay. Just don't kid yourself. (to Jeanette) Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both good boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray and Jeanette leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is there along with Cynthia and the Network Execs. The are more execs than before. Cynthia's people are not ther This entire meeting is on ED TV. Cynthia is quiet - observing. Ed looks whipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three more months?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely! Ed TV is more popular than ever. Congratulations. McILVAINE Only, Ed, we want you, in the next few weeks to spend a lot more time with your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely. Cynthia, explain it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia just stares at her, COLDLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 do it. (to Ed) People want to see what happens to them now. Do your mother and step-father get back together? How does your sister handle being alone? Your feud with your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In fact, we have a new concept. Since your family signed releases, we can follow them on camera even when you're not with them. We can cut around from family member to family member. Whoever's the most exciting at that moment. McILVAINE And, of course, it's another big bonus payment for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of years ago my Uncle Roy got bit on the ass by a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. What the hell is he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he gave me his tickets to the U.S. Open -- the tennis matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still have no idea what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So me and Ray, we tell our friends "Watch when Andre Agassi is gonna serve for the first time. When he's bouncing the ball and it's real quiet, we'11 yell "Whoop". And you'11 all hear us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. (he doesn't)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that is? It's sad. I mean it was just so we could be heard. So we could stand out from the crowd for a second. So we did it. But we had nothing to say. Just "Whoop". That's it. And the stupid part  I mean the really stupid part is we thought it like... elevated us above the crowd. Where the fact is it made us stupider than the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop saying "I see." You don't see. Cynthia, I owe you an apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Because, you didn't talk me into anything. Everything you wanted me to do, I wanted to do.

dialogues.speaker: INT. SHARI'S PLACE
dialogues.text: Shari watching Ed TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) Ray, you were right. It's like in school. I was always saying "the room was too hot, the teacher didn't like me" -- but it was me! Everything that's wrong with my life I did. Okay? So now this is it. My family has problems. Which are our fault. And TV is not the place to solve them. So I quit. I'm taking what very little dignity I've got left and I quit. Can someone validate my parking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause. SHOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Ed, that's ... not really possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'11 pay for the parking. Big network!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scharlach speaks carefully - gently. He's aware of the ca He doesn't want to come off as a villain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean you can't quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very gently) Well, no. You agreed to stay on the air as long as we asked you to. The station entered into this on that understanding. If you had refused we'd have begun this with somebody else. You can't just change the rules in the middle of the game, son. It's not fair to us. More importantly, it's not fair to the viewers. They're interested in you. They've devoted hours and days and weeks of their lives to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you don't let me out of this... I'11 just... I'11 just sit in my apartment all day. I won't go anywhere, I won't do anything. What kind of show will that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not too good. That's why it states in your contract that if you do not continue to live a normal life, you're in violation and are liable for the station's financial losses. Ed, I urge you to reconsider. I urge you on behalf of all those people out there whose lives have become so entwined with yours. Play fair with them, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let them decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns right to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like you all to do me a favor. Turn me off. Just grab the remote and change the channel. I mean, basically, all you're watching now is a guy deteriorate. The only thing missing is the smell. You're better than that  Turn me off. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg bursts in, carrying a sheet of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ratings are up across the board. Look at this! (drones on) Men 18 to 35, women 18 to 35 ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia stares, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed WALKING ZOMBIE-LIKE- CROWDS SWARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is with STEVE, a lawyer. Steve has a huge contract on desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This contract you signed? ... It's a masterpiece. Don't go to war with these guys. You fart in the wrong direction they can take everything you own and leave you naked by the side of the road. You ever going to get back with that Jill? Ooh -- she was nice. Shari, I didn't like that much ("imitates" a gabby girl) "yet-tet-tet-tet-tet-tet-tet."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is sitting alone, eating lunch. He's surrounded by cam and shielded by BODYGUARDS. OUTSIDE the diner a CROWD of rubberneckers is out on the sidewalk, looking in at him, some of them acting up, some staring in. Ed is tired. He glances out the window and ma a MONKEY FACE. Suddenly, he FREEZES. He sees Shari's face in the crowd. She puts her fist in h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed and Shari are walking -- on camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 bailed. I bailed on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what I do. I yell "Geronimo" and jump out of a relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't able to make me feel safe or secure -- no easy job for any  man, I admit -- and my problem is, if I think I'm losing, I pull myself out of the game. I bail. See? I told you, I'm the love coroner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to your hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My truck overheated, so I opened the hood and my hair got caught in the fan belt. So I had to get a haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches her hair. They leap on each other. They're KISSING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big meeting. Many Honchos, including Scharlach and Cynthi All but Cynthia are focused. Cynthia looks bored. HONCHO #l I think this could be great. What if Ed and Shari decide to get married? A wedding? The cute, little half-Asian nephew in a tuxedo, carrying the ring on one of those big fluffy pillows - we'11 kill. A sixty share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A secretary (MILDRED) enters. She's a little flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Mr. Scharlach, um -- you're not watching TV?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mildred, we're working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Ed -- and Shari are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaged?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Here. They're in the building. They're on their way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scharlach indicates that he wants someone to turn on the Someone does and they see Ed and Shari coming down the ha They enter the conference room. The cameras, of course, a with them. Ed is carrying a CARTON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, kids. Busy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just came up to pass out these Ed TV hats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a lot of HATS out of the carton and begins placi the heads of the Honchos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy made these up for me. He spelled Ed with two D's. Okay, listen. The real reason I came up here -- and then I'11 get out of your way -- is I've been thinking about what you said. About let's start having more fun with this show, you know? Let's give it a big kick in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we were thinking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes back that Honcho's hat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have a contest. Now this would mostly be open to professional investigators and detectives. But anyone can join in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rehearsed) What do we have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My lovely assistant, Shari. I'm glad you asked. The contest is who can dig up -- legally, of course -- I'm not suggesting that anyone break any laws -- the most embarrassing and humiliating facts about any of the executives here at the North American Broadcasting System which owns Real TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honchos staring blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But facts! They have to be verified. Anything from their past, their present, business, personal -- arrests, affairs ... And whoever comes up with the sleaziest, most degrading material -- I'11 give you ten thousand dollars. And you get to be on Ed TV. (to the Honchos, excitedly) Hah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So act now. Here's Ed's home phone number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up a CARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's packed with LAWYERS and EXECS. Everyone is agitated, except Cynthia, who seems relaxed-Ed and Shari are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legal?! How can this be legal? It's defamation! It's slander! It's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not, technically. He is not showing a reckless disregard for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting continues ANGRILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Honchos are watching Ed TV. They look STRAINED, ANXIO In Ed's home a BANK OF PHONES have been set up like for a telethon. Manning the phones are Ed, Shari, Ray, Marcia, and Jeanette. The PHONES KEEP RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Uh-huh... uh-huh... Really?! She was how old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the conference room one of the Execs looks DIZZY. The CAMERA PANS to Al on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) He pays a prostitute to do what to him? I don't even want that on my shoes.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: FEAR and SHOCK, except for Cynthia, who is LAUGHING and c stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop laughing or you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. Then she gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got this great idea. We put together a video. "The Network Executives Goofiest Moments." And listen, i've really loved working here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the word "loved" she shot Scharlach THE FINGER. She ex LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed is off the phone,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We have a winner. Now please don't feel badly if yours wasn't selected. In our eyes, you're all winners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And each contestant gets one of these. (holds up a tee-shirt with writing on it) An "I tried to screw a network executive" tee-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred per cent cotton. Okay, here we go, Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed grabs a sealed ENVELOPE. Andy plays a DRUM ROLL -- not terribly well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's available for executions. And the winner is ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he opens the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Executives staring, HORRIFIED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out the card and registers mock-surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the winner is from right here in New York city. Carl Bowers a former orderly at the Martin Center -- a clinic that specializes in, what they call, male enhancement procedures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scharlach's EYES WIDEN in HORROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the camera) How many of you know what a penile implant is? As it was explained to me, what happens is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ed explains, Scharlach reaches for the phone, fumbling for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the man of the hour -- the executive with the winning secret the man who, thanks to the miracle of space-age science and a pump he keeps in his pocket, can now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT OF a television set tuned to Ed. Suddenly Ed is replaced by a Real TV logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that concludes Real TV's coverage of Ed TV. Stay tuned for new programming information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENTERTAINMENT REPORTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spokesperson for Real TV announced that Ed received a check covering his four months on the air, his balloon payment and an additional bonus to show the Network's appreciation for all his -- quote -- hard work and loyalty -- unquote. When asked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In five years no one will even remember this person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years! Six months. He's the "macarena." He's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWS REPORTER is reporting on a wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcia Pekurny, the woman known to most Americans as "Ed's sister" was married here today to Carlos Coto, who some of you may remember as the primary camera operator on "Ed TV" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A news show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The current rage of "Reality Television" got a real dose of reality today. Lifestyle Televisions Joma was shot this evening, outside his apartment. Because Joma was on television twenty-four hours a day, Lifestyle's cameras were there to record the shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE Joma walking into his building. Somebody steps for with a GUN. The ASSAILANT is jostled as he shoots and the bullet hits Joma in the ass. He falls to the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh!!! ... my ass! He shot me in the ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA PANS to the Assailant, who we might recognize someone who we've seen following Ed from time to time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm famous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Ed and Shari watching this on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know him. I gave him an autograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shari turns it off.
